question: The fortification of Calcutta by the British in 1756 was regarded by the Nawab of Bengal, Siraj-ud-Daulah, as
option3: Insecurity of the British in India
explanation: After the death of Alivardi Khan died in 1756, Siraj ud-Daulah succeeded him as the Nawab of Bengal. He was particularly distrustful of the British, and aimed to seize Calcutta. He aimed to drive the British out from his lands. This resulted in a battle between British East India Company and Siraj ud-Daulah. The British were unprepared for the attack on June 20th and were driven out by Siraj-ud-Daula.
